turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Goodnight.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Goodnight.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Goodnight.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Goodnight.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: We are only interested in two visas, Signor.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Please, Ilsa, don't be hasty.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: No, Victor, no.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: No, Ilsa, I won't let you stay here. You must get to America. And believe me, somehow I will get out and join you.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: But, Victor, if the situation were different, if I had to stay and there were only a visa for one, would you take it?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Yes, I would.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Yes, I see. When I had trouble getting out of Lille, why didn't you leave me there? And when I was sick in Marseilles and held you up for two weeks and you were in danger every minute of the time, why didn't you leave me then?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: I meant to, but something always held me up. I love you very much, Ilsa.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: He does. Could we have a table close to him?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: And as far away from Major Strasser as possible.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: What happened with Rick?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: We'll discuss it later.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Our faithful friend is still there.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Victor, please, don't go to the underground meeting tonight.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: I must. Besides, it isn't often that a man has a chance to display heroics before his wife.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Don't joke. After Major Strasser's warning tonight, I am frightened.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: To tell you the truth, I am frightened too. Shall I remain here in our hotel room hiding, or shall I carry on the best I can?

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Whatever I'd say, you'd carry on. Victor, why don't you tell me about Rick? What did you find out?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Apparently he has the letters.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: But no intention of selling them. One would think if sentiment wouldn't persuade him, money would.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Did he give any reason?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: He suggested I ask you.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Ask me?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Yes. He said, "Ask your wife." I don't know why he said that.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Ilsa, I --

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: -- Yes?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: When I was in the concentration camp, were you lonely in Paris?

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Yes, Victor, I was.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: I know how it is to be lonely.  Is there anything you wish to tell me?

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: No, Victor, there isn't.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: I love you very much, my dear.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Yes, Yes I know. Victor, whatever I do, will you believe that I, that --

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: -- You don't even have to say it. I'll believe. Goodnight, dear.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Be careful.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Of course, I'll be careful.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Are you ready Ilsa?

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Yes, I'm ready.  Goodbye, Rick. God bless you.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Captain, the boy who is playing the piano, somewhere I have seen him.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Sam?

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: He came from Paris with Rick.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Rick? Who's he?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Mademoiselle, you are in Rick's and Rick is --

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: -- Is what?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Well, Mademoiselle, he's the kind of a man that, well, if I were a woman and I...  were not around, I should be in love with Rick. But what a fool I am talking to a beautiful woman about another man.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Hello, Rick.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Oh, you've already met Rick, Mademoiselle?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Well then, perhaps you also ---

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: -- This is Mr. Laszlo.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: I can't get over you two. She was asking about you earlier, Rick, in a way that made me extremely jealous.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: I wasn't sure you were the same. Let's see, the last time we met --

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: I'm afraid Major Strasser would insist.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: You're saying this only to make me go.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: How do you do?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: How do you do?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: One hears a great deal about Rick in Casablanca.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: And about Victor Laszlo everywhere.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Won't you join us for a drink?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: And I congratulate you.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Your work.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Thank you. I try.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: We all try. You succeed.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: I hope we didn't overstay our welcome.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Not at all.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: We'll come again.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Any time.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Good morning.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Signor Ferrari is the fat gent at the table.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Good evening.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Good evening. You see, here we are again.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I take that as a great compliment to Sam.  I suppose he means to you Paris of, well, happier days.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Monsieur Blaine, I wonder if I could talk to you?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Well, isn't there some other place? It's rather confidential, what I have to say.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: My office.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: You must know it's very important I get out of Casablanca. It's my privilege to be one of the leaders of a great movement. You know what I have been doing. You know what it means to the work, to the lives of thousands and thousands of people that I be free to reach America and continue my work.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I'm not interested in politics. The problems of the world are not in my department. I'm a saloon keeper.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: My friends in the underground tell me that you have quite a record. You ran guns to Ethiopia. You fought against the fascists in Spain.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: What of it?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Isn't it strange that you always happened to be fighting on the side of the underdog?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Yes. I found that a very expensive hobby, too. But then I never was much of a businessman.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Are you enough of a businessman to appreciate an offer of a hundred thousand francs?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I appreciate it, but I don't accept it.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: I'll raise it to two hundred thousand.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: My friend, you could make it a million francs, or three, my answer would still be the same.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: There must be some reason why you won't let me have them.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: There is. I suggest that you ask your wife.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: I beg your pardon?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I said, ask your wife.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: My wife?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Well, this might come in handy.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Had a close one, eh?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Yes, rather.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Don't you sometimes wonder if it's worth all this? I mean what you're fighting for?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: We might as well question why we breathe. If we stop breathing, we'll die. If we stop fighting our enemies, the world will die.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: What of it? Then it'll be out of it's misery.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: You know how you sound, Monsieur Blaine? Like a man who's trying to convince himself of something he doesn't believe in his heart. Each of us has a destiny, for good or for evil.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Yes, I get the point.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: I wonder if you do. I wonder if you know that you're trying to escape from yourself and that you'll never succeed.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: You seem to know all about my destiny.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: I know a good deal more about you than you suspect. I know, for instance, that you are in love with a woman. It is perhaps strange that we both should be in love with the same woman. The first evening I came here in this cafe, I knew there was something between you and Ilsa. Since no one is to blame, I, I demand no explanation. I ask only one thing. You won't give me the letters of transit. All right. But I want my wife to be safe. I ask you as a favor to use the letters to take her away from Casablanca.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: You love her that much?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Apparently you think of me only as the leader of a cause. Well, I am also a human being.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Monsieur Blaine, I don't know how to thank you.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Oh, save it. We've still lots of things to do.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: I brought the money, Monsieur Blaine.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Keep it. You'll need it in America.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: But we made a deal.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Oh, never mind about that. You won't have any trouble in Lisbon, will you?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: No. It's all arranged.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Good. I've got the letters right here, all made out in blank.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Everything in order?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: All except one thing. There's something you should know before you leave.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Monsieur Blaine, I don't ask you to explain anything.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I'm going to anyway, because it may make a difference to you later on. You said you knew about Ilsa and me.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: But you didn't know she was at my place last night when you were. She came there for the letters of transit. Isn't that true, Ilsa?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Here it is.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Monsieur Laszlo, is it not?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: I am Captain Renault, Prefect of Police.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Yes. What is it you want?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Merely to welcome you to Casablanca and wish you a pleasant stay. It is not often we have so distinguished a visitor.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Thank you. I hope you'll forgive me, Captain, but the present French administration has not always been so cordial. May I present Miss Ilsa Lund?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: I was informed you were the most beautiful woman ever to visit Casablanca. That was a gross understatement.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: No, Captain, please.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: No. Please, Monsieur, it is a little game we play. They put it on the bill, I tear the bill up. It is very convenient.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Let us say that it is my request. That is a much more pleasant word.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Very well.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: My bill.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: No. Two champagne cocktails, please.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Well! A precedent is being broken. Er, Emil!

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: This is a very interesting cafe. I congratulate you.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Ricky, you're becoming quite human. I suppose we have to thank you for that, Mademoiselle.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Ilsa, I don't wish to be the one to say it, but it's late.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: So it is. And we have a curfew here in Casablanca. It would never do for the Chief of Police to be found drinking after hours and have to fine himself.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Tomorrow at ten at the Prefect's office.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: We'll be there.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Goodnight.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: I am delighted to see you both. Did you have a good night's rest?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: I slept very well.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: That's strange. Nobody is supposed to sleep well in Casablanca.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: May we proceed with the business?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: With pleasure. Won't you sit down?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: I am afraid not. My regrets, Monsieur.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Well, perhaps I shall like it in Casablanca.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: And the honor of having served the Third Reich.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: I was in a German concentration camp for a year. That's honor enough for a lifetime.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Monsieur, insofar as it is in my power --

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: -- Thank you.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: By the way, Monsieur, last night you evinced an interest in Signor Ugarte.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: I believe you have a message for him?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Nothing important, but may I speak to him now?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: I am making out the report now. We haven't quite decided whether he committed suicide or died trying to escape.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Are you quite finished with us?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: I'm sure you'll excuse me if I am not gracious, but you see, Major Strasser, I'm a Czechoslovakian.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: You were a Czechoslovakian. Now you are a subject of the German Reich!

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: I've never accepted that privilege, and I'm now on French soil.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: I should like to discuss some matters arising from your presence on French soil.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: This is hardly the time or the place.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Then we shall state another time and another place. Tomorrow at ten in the Prefect's office, with Mademoiselle.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Captain Renault, I am under your authority. Is it your order that we come to your office?

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Very well, Herr Laszlo, we will not mince words. You are an escaped prisoner of the Reich. So far you have been fortunate enough in eluding us. You have reached Casablanca. It is my duty to see that you stay in Casablanca.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Whether or not you succeed is, of course, problematical.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Not at all. Captain Renault's signature is necessary on every exit visa.  Captain, would you think it is possible that Herr Laszlo will receive a visa?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Is that all you wish to tell us?

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Don't be in such a hurry. You have all the time in the world. You may be in Casablanca indefinitely... or you may leave for Lisbon tomorrow, on one condition.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: And that is?

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: You know the leaders of the underground movement in Paris, in Prague, in Brussels, in Amsterdam, in Oslo, in Belgrade, in Athens.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Even in Berlin.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Yes, even in Berlin. If you will furnish me with their names and their exact whereabouts, you will have your visa in the morning.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: You will give us the names?

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: If I didn't give them to you in a concentration camp where you had more "persuasive methods" at your disposal, I certainly won't give them to you now.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: And what if you track down these men and kill them? What if you murdered all of us? From every corner of Europe, hundreds, thousands, would rise to take our places. Even Nazis can't kill that fast.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Herr Laszlo, you have a reputation for eloquence which I can now understand. But in one respect you are mistaken. You said the enemies of the Reich could all be replaced, but there is one exception. No one could take your place in the event anything unfortunate should occur to you while you were trying to escape.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: You won't dare to interfere with me here. This is still unoccupied France. Any violation of neutrality would reflect on Captain Renault.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: For the time being.

turns.speaker: LASZLO
turns.text: Good day.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Unoccupied France welcomes you to Casablanca.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Thank you, Captain. It's very good to be here.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Major Strasser, my aide, Lieutenant Casselle.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: You may find the climate of Casablanca a trifle warm, Major.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Oh, we Germans must get used to all climates, from Russia to the Sahara. But perhaps you were not referring to the weather.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: What else, my dear Major?

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: By the way, the murder of the couriers, what has been done?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Realizing the importance of the case, my men are rounding up twice the usual number of suspects.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Oh, there is no hurry. Tonight he'll be at Rick's. Everybody comes to Rick's.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: I have already heard about this cafe, and also about Mr. Rick himself.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Good evening, gentlemen.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Good evening, Captain.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Thank you. It is a pleasure to have you here, Major.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Champagne and a tin of caviar.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: May I recommend Veuve Cliquot '26, a good French wine.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Especially so tonight, Major. In a few minutes you will see the arrest of the man who murdered your couriers.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: I expected no less, Captain.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Rick, this is Major Heinrich Strasser of the Third Reich.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: How do you do, Mr. Rick?

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: You repeat "Third Reich" as though you expected there to be others.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Well, personally, Major, I will take what comes.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Do you mind if I ask you a few questions? Unofficially, of course.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Ho, diplomatist!

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: How about New York?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Rick is completely neutral about everything. And that takes in the field of women, too.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: You weren't always so carefully neutral. We have a complete dossier on you.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Of course, one must admit he has great courage.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: I admit he is very clever. Three times he slipped through our fingers. In Paris he continued his activities. We intend not to let it happen again.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: You see, Major, you have nothing to worry about Rick.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Perhaps.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Mademoiselle.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Mademoiselle.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: I strongly suspect that Ugarte left the letters of transit with Mr. Blaine. I would suggest you search the cafe immediately and thoroughly.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: If Rick has the letters, he's much too smart to let you find them there.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: You give him credit for too much cleverness. My impression was that he's just another blundering American.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: But we mustn't underestimate American blundering. I was with them when they "blundered" into Berlin in 1918.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: As to Laszlo, we want him watched twenty-four hours a day.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: It may interest you to know that at this very moment he is on his way here.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: You see, Captain, the situation is not as much under control as you believe.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: My dear Major, we are trying to cooperate with your government, but we cannot regulate the feelings of our people.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Captain Renault, are you entirely certain which side you're on?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: I have no conviction, if that's what you mean. I blow with the wind, and the prevailing wind happens to be from Vichy.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: And if it should change?

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: We are concerned about more than Casablanca. We know that every French province in Africa is honeycombed with traitors waiting for their chance, waiting, perhaps, for a leader.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: A leader, like Laszlo?

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Uh, huh. I have been thinking. It is too dangerous if we let him go. It may be too dangerous if we let him stay.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: I see what you mean.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: You see what I mean? If Laszlo's presence in a cafe can inspire this unfortunate demonstration, what more will his presence in Casablanca bring on? I advise that this place be shut up at once.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: But everybody's having such a good time.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Yes, much too good a time. The place is to be closed.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: But I have no excuse to close it.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Find one.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: What is the meaning of that phone call?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Victor Laszlo is on that plane.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Why do you stand here? Why don't you stop him?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Ask Monsieur Rick.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Hello, Louis.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: How extravagant you are, throwing away women like that. Someday they may be scarce.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: You know, I think now I shall pay a call on Yvonne, maybe get her on the rebound, eh?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: When it comes to women, you're a true democrat.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: The plane to Lisbon.  You would like to be on it?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Why? What's in Lisbon?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: The clipper to America.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: It was a combination of all three.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: And what in heaven's name brought you to Casablanca?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: My health. I came to Casablanca for the waters.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Waters? What waters? We're in the desert.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I was misinformed.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Huh!

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Rick, there's going to be some excitement here tonight. We are going to make an arrest in your cafe.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: What, again?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: This is no ordinary arrest. A murderer, no less.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: If you are thinking of warning him, don't put yourself out. He cannot possibly escape.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I stick my neck out for nobody.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: A wise foreign policy.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: You know, Rick, we could have made this arrest earlier in the evening at the Blue Parrot, but out of my high regard for you we are staging it here. It will amuse your customers.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Our entertainment is enough.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I see. And what's Strasser doing here? He certainly didn't come all the way to Casablanca to witness a demonstration of your efficiency.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Perhaps not.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: How observant you are. As a matter of fact, I wanted to give you a word of advice.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Yeah? Have a brandy?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Thank you. Rick, there are many exit visas sold in this cafe, but we know that you have never sold one. That is the reason we permit you to remain open.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I thought it was because we let you win at roulette.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: That is another reason. There is a man who's arrived in Casablanca on his way to America. He will offer a fortune to anyone who will furnish him with an exit visa.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Yeah? What's his name?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Victor Laszlo.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Victor Laszlo?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Rick, that is the first time I have ever seen you so impressed.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Well, he's succeeded in impressing half the world.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: It is my duty to see that he doesn't impress the other half. Rick, Laszlo must never reach America. He stays in Casablanca.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: It'll be interesting to see how he manages.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Manages what?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: His escape.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Oh, but I just told you. --

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: -- Stop it. He escaped from a concentration camp and the Nazis have been chasing him all over Europe.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: This is the end of the chase.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Twenty thousand francs says it isn't.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Is that a serious offer?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I just paid out twenty. I'd like to get it back.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Make it ten. I am only a poor corrupt official.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Done. No matter how clever he is, he still needs an exit visa, or I should say, two.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Why two?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: He is traveling with a lady.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: He'll take one.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: I think not. I have seen the lady. And if he did not leave her in Marseilles, or in Oran, he certainly won't leave her in Casablanca.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Maybe he's not quite as romantic as you are.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: It doesn't matter. There is no exit visa for him.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Louis, whatever gave you the impression that I might be interested in helping Laszlo escape?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Because, my dear Ricky, I suspect that under that cynical shell you're at heart a sentimentalist.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Oh, laugh if you will, but I happen to be familiar with your record. Let me point out just two items. In 1935 you ran guns to Ethiopia. In 1936, you fought in Spain on the Loyalist side.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: And got well paid for it on both occasions.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: The winning side would have paid you much better.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Maybe. Well, it seems you are determined to keep Laszlo here.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: I have my orders.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Oh, I see. Gestapo spank.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Yeah, you were saying?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Oh, how do you do?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: And you already know Herr Heinze of the Third Reich.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: That makes Rick a citizen of the world.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I was born in New York City if that'll help you any.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Well, you were asking about Rick and here he is. Mademoiselle, may I present --

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: -- Hello, Ilsa.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Oh, no, Rick never --

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: -- Thanks. I will.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Oh, it's my party.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Another precedent gone. This has been a very interesting evening. I'll call you a cab. Gasoline rationing, time of night.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Well, Ricky. I'm very pleased with you. Now you're beginning to live like a Frenchman.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: That was some going-over your men gave my place this afternoon. We just barely got cleaned up in time to open.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Well, I told Strasser he wouldn't find the letters here. But I told my men to be especially destructive. You know how that impresses Germans?  Rick, have you got these letters of transit?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Louis, are you pro-Vichy or Free French?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Serves me right for asking a direct question. The subject is closed.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Well, it looks like you're a little late.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: So Yvonne's gone over to the enemy.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Who knows? In her own way she may constitute an entire second front. I think it's time for me to flatter Major Strasser a little. I'll see you later, Rick.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: As I suspected, you're a rank sentimentalist.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Yeah? Why?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Why do you interfere with my little romances?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Put it down as a gesture to love.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Well, I forgive you this time. But I'll be in tomorrow night with a breathtaking blonde, and it will make me very happy if she loses. Uh huh!
